items.label: Effortless Task Inspection with Default Cards
Easy Custom Reports with Card Components
Advanced, Shareable Cards with Card Templates

getting-started/install.title: Installing Metaflow
getting-started/install.description: Metaflow is available as a Python package for MacOS and Linux. You can visit our GitHub repository or get the latest version from PyPI:

getting-started/tutorials/README.title: Tutorials
getting-started/tutorials/README.description: This set of tutorials provides a hands-on introduction to Metaflow. The basic concepts are introduced in practice, and you can find out more details about the functionality showcased in these tutorials in Basics of Metaflow and the following sections.

getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the-l.title: Episode 1: Playlist
getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the-l.description: Let's build you a movie playlist.

getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the-l.title: Season 1: The Local Experience
getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the-l.description: This season focus on introducing the basics of Metaflow. You can run all these tutorials on your local machine.

getting-started/tutorials/season-2-scali.title: Episode 5: Hello AWS
getting-started/tutorials/season-2-scali.description: Look Mom, We're in the Cloud.

getting-started/tutorials/season-2-scali.title: Season 2: Scaling Out and Up
getting-started/tutorials/season-2-scali.description: This season introduces how to use Metaflow on AWS. To run through these tutorials, you will either need to setup Metaflow on AWS or use the Metaflow Sandbox.

going-to-production-with-metaflow/coordi.title: Coordinating Larger Metaflow Projects
going-to-production-with-metaflow/coordi.description: Most Metaflow projects start as a simple Python script that is developed by a single data scientist. Metaflow takes care of keeping results organized automatically, so you can focus on developing models and the business logic around them.

going-to-production-with-metaflow/schedu.title: Scheduling Metaflow Flows
going-to-production-with-metaflow/schedu.description: A key feature of Metaflow is to make it easy to take machine learning pipelines from prototyping to production. This sentence and a number of other Metaflow documents use the word production casually. What do we actually mean by it?

index.title: Welcome to Metaflow for Python
index.description: Build and manage real-life data science projects with ease.

internals-of-metaflow/technical-overview.title: Technical Overview
internals-of-metaflow/technical-overview.description: Make sure you have read Basics of Metaflow before diving into technical details below. You can find more technical details at the infrastructure level in Administrator's Guide to Metaflow. This document focuses on the Metaflow codebase.

internals-of-metaflow/testing-philosophy.title: Testing Philosophy
internals-of-metaflow/testing-philosophy.description: Watch this talk for motivation: Autonomous Testing and the Future of Software Development by Will Wilson.

introduction/contributing-to-metaflow.title: Contributing to Metaflow
introduction/contributing-to-metaflow.description: First off, thanks for taking the time!

introduction/getting-in-touch.title: Get in Touch
introduction/getting-in-touch.description: Thank you for your interest in Metaflow. We are here to help.

introduction/release-notes.title: Release Notes
introduction/release-notes.description: Read below how Metaflow has improved over time.

introduction/roadmap.title: Roadmap
introduction/roadmap.description: Metaflow has been used in production at Netflix since early 2018. The core Metaflow was open-sourced in December 2019. Some features of Metaflow are not available in open-source yet but we may open-source them later if there is sufficient external interest. These features are listed below.

introduction/what-is-metaflow.title: What is Metaflow
introduction/what-is-metaflow.description: Metaflow is a human-friendly Python library that helps scientists and engineers build and manage real-life data science projects. Metaflow was originally developed at Netflix to boost the productivity of data scientists who work on a wide variety of projects from classical statistics to state-of-the-art deep learning.

metaflow-on-aws/deploy-to-aws.title: Deploying to AWS
metaflow-on-aws/deploy-to-aws.description: See the Administrator's Guide to Metaflow

metaflow-on-aws/metaflow-on-aws.title: Metaflow on AWS
metaflow-on-aws/metaflow-on-aws.description: Traditionally, there has been a tension between local \(e.g. on a laptop\) and remote \(e.g. on a cluster or a cloud\) development and execution: Developing on a laptop is fast, whereas iterating with a remote cluster is slower. A laptop is a severely resource-constrained environment whereas a cluster can have virtually unlimited resources. Worse, simple local scripts may need to be translated to a new paradigm that is understood by a cluster.

metaflow-on-aws/metaflow-sandbox.title: Metaflow Sandbox
metaflow-on-aws/metaflow-sandbox.description: As described in Metaflow on AWS, Metaflow comes with built-in integrations to various services on AWS. The seamless integration to the cloud is a key benefit of Metaflow.

metaflow/basics.title: Basics of Metaflow
metaflow/basics.description: This document introduces the basic concepts of Metaflow. If you are eager to try out Metaflow in practice, you can start with the tutorial. After the tutorial, you can return to this document to learn more about how Metaflow works.

metaflow/client.title: Inspecting Flows and Results
metaflow/client.description: Metaflow provides a client API that is used to inspect results of past runs. It is particularly well suited to being used in notebooks.

metaflow/data.title: Loading and Storing Data
metaflow/data.description: This chapter describes tools and patterns for moving data in and out of your Metaflow flows.

metaflow/debugging.title: Debugging with Metaflow
metaflow/debugging.description: Metaflow wants to make debugging failed flows as painless as possible.

metaflow/dependencies.title: Managing External Libraries
metaflow/dependencies.description: What if your step code wants to import an external library? When you run Metaflow code locally, it behaves as any other Python code, so all libraries available to your Python interpreter can be imported in steps.

metaflow/failures.title: Dealing with Failures
metaflow/failures.description: Failures are a natural, expected part of data science workflows. Here are some typical reasons why you can expect your workflow to fail:

metaflow/scaling.title: Scaling Out and Up
metaflow/scaling.description: From a usability point of view, it is hard to beat the convenience of writing and running a straightforward script in the comfort of your favorite IDE and a local terminal. Since one of the core values of Metaflow is usability, we encourage you to start with this easy approach and not worry about scalability until it becomes an issue.

metaflow/tagging.title: Organizing Results
metaflow/tagging.description: A boring, under-appreciated part of high-quality science (or any project work in general), is keeping results organized. This is the key to effective collaboration, versioning of parallel lines of work, and reproducibility.

metaflow/visualizing-results/advanced-sh.title: Advanced, Shareable Cards with Card Templates
metaflow/visualizing-results/advanced-sh.description: The built-in Card Components allow you to create a visual report with a few lines of Python code. This is by far the easiest way to output visualizations using Metaflowâ€™s default visual style and layout.

metaflow/visualizing-results/easy-custom.title: Easy Custom Reports with Card Components
metaflow/visualizing-results/easy-custom.description: Default Cards are useful during development when you need to quickly inspect artifacts produced by a task or visualize the overall structure of the flow. As your project progresses, you may want to create a custom card that highlights information specific to your project.

metaflow/visualizing-results/effortless-.title: Effortless Task Inspection with Default Cards
metaflow/visualizing-results/effortless-.description: Metaflow comes with a built-in Default Card that shows all artifacts produced by a task. Letâ€™s create a simple flow to test it.

metaflow/visualizing-results/README.title: Visualizing Results
metaflow/visualizing-results/README.description: What if you want to share results of flows with human beings or inspect results by yourself? One option is to use Jupyter notebooks and Metaflow Client API, which is a good combination for ad-hoc analysis and exploration.

r/getting-started/development-environmen.title: Development Environment
r/getting-started/development-environmen.description: You can install and use Metaflow easily within your favorite IDE, whether it is RStudio, a Jupyter Notebook, vim/emacs on your terminal, or any other IDE.

r/getting-started/tutorials/README.title: Tutorials
r/getting-started/tutorials/README.description: This set of tutorials provides a hands-on introduction to Metaflow. The basic concepts are introduced in practice, and you can find out more details about the functionality showcased in these tutorials in Basics of Metaflow and the following sections.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.title: Episode 1: Playlist
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.description: This flow loads a movie metadata CSV file and builds a playlist for your favorite movie genre. Everything in Metaflow is versioned, so you can run it multiple times and view all the historical playlists with the Metaflow client in an R Markdown Notebook.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.title: Episode 2: Statistics
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.description: Use Metaflow to load the movie metadata CSV file into a data frame and compute some movie genre specific statistics. These statistics are then used in later examples to improve our playlist generator.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.title: Episode 3: Playlist Redux
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.description: Use Metaflow to load the statistics generated from Episode 2 Is this Data Science and recommend movies from a genre with highest median gross box office

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.title: Season 1: The Local Experience
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-1-the.description: This season focus on introducing the basics of Metaflow. You can run all these tutorials on your local machine.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.title: Episode 4: Look Mom, We're in the Cloud.
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.description: This flow is a simple linear workflow that verifies your AWS configuration. The start and end steps will run locally, while the hello step will run remotely on AWS batch.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.title: Episode 5: Hello AWS
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.description: This flow is a simple linear workflow that verifies your AWS configuration. The start and end steps will run locally, while the hello step will run remotely on AWS batch.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.title: Episode 6: Statistics Redux
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.description: This example revisits Episode 02-statistics: Is this Data Science?.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.title: Episode 7: Worldview
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.description: This episode shows how you can use a notebook to setup a simple dashboard to monitor all of your Metaflow flows.

r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.title: Season 2: Scaling Out and Up
r/getting-started/tutorials/season-2-sca.description: This season introduces how to use Metaflow on AWS. To run through these tutorials, you will either need to setup Metaflow on AWS or use the Metaflow Sandbox.

r/going-to-production-with-metaflow/sche.title: Scheduling Metaflow Flows
r/going-to-production-with-metaflow/sche.description: A key feature of Metaflow is to make it easy to take machine learning pipelines from prototyping to production. This sentence and a number of other Metaflow documents use the word production casually. What do we actually mean by it?

r/introduction/contributing-to-metaflow.description: First off, thanks for taking the time!

r/introduction/getting-in-touch.description: Thank you for your interest in Metaflow. We are here to help. The team is most active on our Gitter channel.

r/introduction/release-notes.description: Read below how Metaflow has improved over time.
